metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9764 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: HashiCorp Consul 1.4.3 lacks server hostname verification for agent-to-agent TLS communication. In other words, the product behaves as if verify_server_hostname were set to false, even when it is actually set to true. This is fixed in 1.4.4.

notes.Note: alexmurray> Upstream says this only affects 1.4.3 and is fixed in 1.4.4 but it is not clear if earlier versions were affected or not so leaving as needs-triage for bionic with version 0.6.4~dfsg-3

criterions.comment: consul: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
